ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Did the subject pass screening?
If did not pass screening, please explain:
Notes: 1 = TBR; 2 = Vitamin D; 3 = Full Scale IQ; 4 = Teacher Ratings; 5 = Convergence Insufficiency; 6 = Family Withdrew Consent; 7 = Time/Schedule Commitment; 8 = Family unwilling to risk sham; 9 = Didn't complete all screening; 97 = Other (please specify)

ElementDescription: Explain other reason why subject failed screening
Will the subject be randomized
If subject PASSED screen but will NOT be randomized, please explain
Notes: 1 = Family Withdrew Consent; 2 = Time/Schedule Commitment; 3 = Family unwilling to risk sham assignment; 97 = Other (please specify)

ElementDescription: Explain other reason why subject was not randomized
Has a clinician confirmed these results?
Is washout required
Did the child's parent/guardian sign consent
Consent Date

Does the subject have an item mean of greater than or equal to 1.5 sd above norm on parent and teacher ratings of either DSM-IV inattentive symptoms or all 18 ADHD symptoms?
Does the subject have a theta/beta ratio (TBR) of 4.5 or more on EEG at Fz or Cz?
EEG Fz Ratio
EEG Cz Ratio
